txt.en: 'The spear is very often favoured by Wardens, [placeholder], but its art is not easily mastered. A skilled teacher is needed to get the most from such a weapon and to make use of its advanced techniques.\n\n'Andrew Oakhurst of Bree often leads the Wardens of Bree-land in practice skirmishes aimed at improving their skills with the spear. You should speak to Warden Oakhurst at the West-gate of Bree-town if you wish to engage in one of these practices.'

'The spear is very often favoured by Wardens, [placeholder], but its art is not easily mastered. You should speak to Warden Oakhurst at the West-gate of Bree-town if you wish to engage in one of these practices.'
A Spear at the Southern March

'Will you join my line, [placeholder]? It will require discipline and toughness, but as a Warden these are characteristics you should already have!'\n\n<rgb=#FF0000>This is a Solo quest, and cannot be completed with a Fellowship.</rgb>

Andrew Oakhurst is by the West-gate of Bree.\n\nYou have been told to speak to Andrew Oakhurst about participating in the spear-training that he often runs for Wardens in Bree-land.

'Andrew Oakhurst of Bree often leads the Wardens of Bree-land in practice skirmishes aimed at improving their skills with the spear. You should speak to Warden Oakhurst at the West-gate of Bree-town if you wish to engage in one of these practices.'

You should speak to Warden Oakhurst at the West-gate of Bree-town if you wish to engage in one of these practices.'
Andrew Oakhurst is at the West-gate of the town of Bree.\n\nA band of brigands march on Bree from the south, and Andrew Oakhurst has asked you to join his line of Wardens in repelling them.

'Andrew Oakhurst of Bree often leads the Wardens of Bree-land in practice skirmishes aimed at improving their skills with the spear. You should speak to Warden Oakhurst at the West-gate of Bree-town if you wish to engage in one of these practices.'

Andrew Oakhurst is at the West-gate of Bree.\n\nYou have stood in the line that defended Bree from attack and should speak now with Warden Oakhurst.

Talk to Andrew Oakhurst and join his line of Wardens

'Andrew Oakhurst of Bree often leads the Wardens of Bree-land in practice skirmishes aimed at improving their skills with the spear. You should speak to Warden Oakhurst at the West-gate of Bree-town if you wish to engage in one of these practices.'
'You are welcome in my line on any occasion, [placeholder].'
'A line of Wardens must be a frightening prospect for the enemy to face!'
'A line of Wardens must be a frightening prospect for the enemy to face!'

'The spear is very often favoured by Wardens, [placeholder], but its art is not easily mastered. A skilled teacher is needed to get the most from such a weapon and to make use of its advanced techniques.\n\n'Andrew Oakhurst of Bree often leads the Wardens of Bree-land in practice skirmishes aimed at improving their skills with the spear. You should speak to Warden Oakhurst at the West-gate of Bree-town if you wish to engage in one of these practices.'

'You seek training to better your offensive skills, friend Warden? I have not prepared a practice skirmish.

'No, do not leave just yet! There is no practice skirmish because there is a very real threat that approaches from the south: a band of brigands has managed to obtain some level of organization and prepares to attack Bree-town!

'You will receive no better training as a Warden than by passing through the crucible of battle, my friend. If you will join my line, I can personally assure that you will learn much of value.'

'You performed admirably well, [placeholder], and are welcome on my line whenever you care to serve.\n\n'I believe you will find that the experience has given you a chance to refine your skills and test your discipline, a chance at which every Warden would rejoice!'

'You performed admirably well, [placeholder], and are welcome on my line whenever you care to serve.\n\n'I believe you will find that the experience has given you a chance to refine your skills and test your discipline, a chance at which every Warden would rejoice!'
Wardens often favour the spear, and truly effective spear-use is something that must be taught by one who has used it often and well in many battles.

'The spear is very often favoured by Wardens, [placeholder], but its art is not easily mastered. A skilled teacher is needed to get the most from such a weapon and to make use of its advanced techniques.\n\n'Andrew Oakhurst of Bree often leads the Wardens of Bree-land in practice skirmishes aimed at improving their skills with the spear. You should speak to Warden Oakhurst at the West-gate of Bree-town if you wish to engage in one of these practices.'
